t: Isaiah 33
A Prayer in Deep Distress

Woe*pn to you who plunder, though you have*i not been*i plundered; And*ld you who deal treacherously, though they have not dealt treacherously with you! When*ld you cease plundering, You*ld will be plundered; When*ld you make an end of dealing treacherously, They*ld will deal treacherously with you.
O*ln Lord,*s be gracious to us; We*ld have waited for You. Be*ld their arm every morning, Our*ld salvation also in the time of trouble.
At*ld the noise of the tumult the people shall flee; When*ld You lift Yourself up, the nations shall be scattered;
And*ld Your plunder shall be gathered Like*ild the gathering of the caterpillar; As*ld the running to and fro of locusts, He*ld shall run upon them.
The*ln Lord*s is exalted, for He dwells on high; He*ld has filled Zion with justice and righteousness.
Wisdom*ld and knowledge will be the stability of your times, And*ild the strength of salvation; The*ld fear of the Lord*s is*i His treasure.
Surely*ln their valiant ones shall cry outside, The*ld ambassadors of peace shall weep bitterly.
The*ld highways lie waste, The*ld traveling man ceases. He*ld has broken the covenant, He*ld has despised the cities, He*ld regards no man.
The*ld earth mourns and*i languishes, Lebanon*ld is shamed and*i shriveled; Sharon*ld is like a wilderness, And*ld Bashan and Carmel shake off their*i fruits.*i
Impending Judgment on Zion
“Now*pn I will rise,” says the Lord;*s “Now*ld I will be exalted, Now*ld I will lift Myself up.
You*ld shall conceive chaff, You*ld shall bring forth stubble; Your*ld breath, as*i fire, shall devour you.
And*ld the people shall be like*i the burnings of lime; Like*ild thorns cut up they shall be burned in the fire.
Hear,*ld you who*i are*i afar off, what I have done; And*ld you who*i are*i near, acknowledge My might.”
The*ln sinners in Zion are afraid; Fearfulness*ld has seized the hypocrites: “Who*ld among us shall dwell with the devouring fire? Who*ld among us shall dwell with everlasting burnings?”

He*ld who walks righteously and speaks uprightly, He*ld who despises the gain of oppressions, Who*ld gestures with his hands, refusing bribes, Who*ld stops his ears from hearing of bloodshed, And*ld shuts his eyes from seeing evil:
He*ld will dwell on high; His*ld place of defense will*i be*i the fortress of rocks; Bread*ld will be given him, His*ld water will*i be*i sure.
The Land of the Majestic King
Your*pn eyes will see the King in His beauty; They*ld will see the land that is very far off.
Your*ld heart will meditate on terror: “Where*ld is*i the scribe? Where*ld is*i he who weighs? Where*ld is*i he who counts the towers?”
You*ld will not see a fierce people, A*ld people of obscure speech, beyond perception, Of*ld a stammering tongue that*i you*i cannot understand.

Look*ln upon Zion, the city of our appointed feasts; Your*ld eyes will see Jerusalem, a quiet home, A*ld tabernacle that*i will not be taken down; Not*ld one of its stakes will ever be removed, Nor*ld will any of its cords be broken.
But*ld there the majestic Lord*s will*i be*i for us A*ld place of broad rivers and*i streams, In*ld which no galley with oars will sail, Nor*ld majestic ships pass by
(For*ld the Lord*s is*i our Judge, The*ld Lord*s is*i our Lawgiver, The*ld Lord*s is*i our King; He*ld will save us);
Your*ld tackle is loosed, They*ld could not strengthen their mast, They*ld could not spread the sail. Then*ln the prey of great plunder is divided; The*ld lame take the prey.
And*ld the inhabitant will not say, “I am sick”; The*ld people who dwell in it will*i be*i forgiven their*i iniquity.
